manifest.name: has-proto
manifest.description: Does this environment have the ability to get the [[Prototype]] of an object on creation with `__proto__`?

scripts.postversion: auto-changelog && git add CHANGELOG.md && git commit --no-edit --amend && git tag -f "v$(node -e "console.log(require('./package.json').version)")"

manifest.readme:
# has-proto <sup>[![Version Badge][npm-version-svg]][package-url]</sup>

[![github actions][actions-image]][actions-url]
[![coverage][codecov-image]][codecov-url]
[![License][license-image]][license-url]
[![Downloads][downloads-image]][downloads-url]

[![npm badge][npm-badge-png]][package-url]

Does this environment have the ability to set the [[Prototype]] of an object on creation with `__proto__`?

## Example

```js
var hasProto = require('has-proto');
var assert = require('assert');

assert.equal(typeof hasProto(), 'boolean');
```

## Tests
Simply clone the repo, `npm install`, and run `npm test`
